text:
we are useing webct (www.webct.com) virtual learning software, and it was
configured to use ndbm files for user databases. since 2.0.32 (I think), users
were not be able to log in. It appears that NDBM files are not supported any more.

from url given above, you can find udiff with ndbm support implementation,
apr_dbm_ndbm.c and some integration. I have made some tests with testdbm as well.

as dbm_* calls are implemented in libc in solaris, it may needed to use -lc
before -lgdbm, as gdbm lib will provide dbm_* api as well, but it seems to be
not compatible with ndbm created databases:(

I hope, this code will be useful.

BerkeleyDB API is different, no dbm_ calls. no dbm_ calls are used in gode as
well... so how can linking against it help?

SDBM - not compatible with ndbm databases
GDBM - not compatible with ndbm databases
DB (hash as you can find from apr_dbm_berkeleydb.c) also not compatible with
ndbm databases....

GDBM will provide you API to use it as direct replacement, but it still can't
use real ndbm files....

text:
Toomas.
This code has been applied, and should be available in 2.0.41
Can you PLEASE check the dbm suupport.
and close the bug if this works for you.

it's almost there. the code itself is working, but library order is the problem now.

in solaris, native ndbm functions are in libc, but gdbm does have them as well
(to support dbm_api). the problem is that gdbm functions are not compatible with
libc functions, so, at link time, -lc must be BEFORE -lgdbm, not after. I had to
modify this manually and after this change the daemon was able to use ndbm files.

so, if this last issue is fixed, the bug can be closed.
